com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE


  • public interface YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalDataForValidationUE(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE user exit is invoked to obtain customer-defined data for use in validating the Validation and Overridden Rules of the Manager Overrides Framework.

    • Method Detail

      • getExternalDataForValidationUE

        org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalDataForValidationUE(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSGetExternalDataForValidationUE user exit is invoked to obtain customer-defined data for use in validating the Validation and Overridden Rules of the Manager Overrides Framework.

        This user exit is intended to recieve a well-formed input XML that can be repopulated with data from an external system to customize the validation performed by the Manager Overrides Framework. The template for this input XML is available via the InputTemplate path configured for the Validation. It also expects certain fields relating to the currently operating Validation to be provided as a reference to the external system.

        • The ValidationKey uniquely identifying the Validation.
        • The ValidationID uniquely identifying the Validation.
        • The OrganizationCode that defines the Organization that the Validation belongs to.
        • The Domain that identifies the Validation Domain that the Validation belongs to. (ie: "Order")
        • The APIName that identifies the API that is calling the User Exit.
        • The TransactionInfoID that identifies the current transaction.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        The user exit implementation can get the enterprise code from the environment variable by calling the getUEParam(String variable) method.

        Example : env.getUEParam("EnterpriseCode")


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is invoked conditionally if implemented.

        Post-conditions: None.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. An XML containing the key attributes of the customer to be retrieved. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML containing the details of the requested customer. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
